title: Even after 1939 most German mappers did not espouse such a mode of presentation. See Lohse, Völkerwanderungskarte, 50–52. Around 1950, however, a geopolitically minded map of the migration period was still published by Renate Riemeck and Hans Voigt: Kleiner Geschichtsatlas. Oldenburg [s.d.], 4. In his discussion of this map collection Lehn, Deutschlandbilder, 394–96, does not mention that Riemeck in 1941 became a member of the NSDAP

title: Anna Cento Bull is Professor of Italian History and Politics at the University of Bath, UK. She has published widely on political terrorism in Italy, including Italian Neofascism

note: Spaces of Experience: Art Gallery Interiors from 1800–2000 (Yale University Press, 2009) and most recently, Terror: Wenn Bilder zu Waffen werden (S. Fischer Verlag, 2017).
title: Charlotte Klonk is Professor of Art History and New Media at the Institute of Art History and Visual History at Humboldt University Berlin. She currently researches the history, role and dynamic of images in acts of terror. Her publications include Science and the Perception of Nature

note: It will be preserved as a commemorative space in the Dornier Museum, Friedrichshafen.
title: Martin Rupps is a political scientist, historian and journalist, author and editor at Südwestfunk. His publications include: Die Überlebenden von Mogasischu (Berlin 2012); Der Lotse Helmut Schmidt und die Deutschen (Zurich 2015); and Kanzlerdämmerung. Wer zu spat kommt, darf regieren
He initiated the effort to return the former Lufthansa airliner “Landshut” to Germany in the fall of 2017

container-title: Revolutionary Violence and the New Left: Transnational Perspectives
note: Die Rote Armee Fraktion. Eine Geschichte terroristischer Gewalt, München (Beck) 2017.
title: Petra Terhoeven is Professor for European Contemporary and Cultural History at Georg-August-University, Göttingen. She has published on Italian fascism and left-wing terrorism in its transnational context, including: Deutscher Herbst in Europa. Der Linksterrorismus der siebziger Jahre als transnationales Phänomen, München (Oldenburg) 2014; Hitler ́s Children? German Terrorism as Part of the ‘New Left Wave’
